document.heading: Child Support and Welfare Reform Compliance Amendment Act of 2000

history.narrative: Law 13-269, the “Child Support and Welfare Reform Compliance Amendment Act of 2000”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-254, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 8, 2000, and December 5, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 8, 2001, it was assigned Act No. 13-559 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-269 became effective on April 3, 2001.
